reviews.review_msg: Prof Gbedoah is an amazing lecturer. He is always ready to help students outside the classroom.
Prof Richard is one the best professors I have ever met. He gives clear instructions on assignments with good feedback. Always ready to go the extra mile to make all students are on the same page.

I found that Richard was particularly harsh as a TA this semester. He seems like a nice guy, but the way he marked assignments was vastly different from the prof, resulting in a grade cleavage within the class. Additionally, he is one of those instructors that brags about never giving out A+ grades which seems rather pointless.
She's so Caring and she doesn't trick you with what's on the exam or how shell mark HIGHLY recommend her
Extremely knowledgeable and well respected. Very nice, too!

Clare is very fair and easy to get help from outside of class. She is obviously very caring and learned almost names within a week or two. The content can be boring at times (especially in the textbook) but Clare makes it much more interesting.

Her British accent is interesting to listen to. She makes the subject interesting. We had a guest lecturer but he wasn't as captivating as her. midterm was fairly easy. Past halfway through the semester and I'm basically done with everything, but this class is still genuinely interesting. Strict criteria, but but very helpful with questions

This course was enjoyable and not very difficult, but it definitely caters toward students with a keen interest in political studies. Clare is a very knowledgeable professor, though she tends to spend too much time explaining examples to accompany her points while lecturing. Her and the TAs were extremely helpful in providing advice, and very fair.

This class was a mess. Every single outline was at least 20 pages so it was hard to understand anything. The syllabus is ridiculously long and confusing, and she doesn't even follow it. You don't get marks until the last minute and communication is a huge problem.

Disorganized professor. Gave us an unreasonable amount of readings each week. Stopped following her syllabus half way through the course because she realized she could not keep up with the markings for the homework she gave out herself. She also handed back most of the assignments after the final exam. It was very difficult to get feedback.

I selected "not sure yet" for my grade and I don't think I will ever know what it is. Linda takes MONTHS to mark, is EXTREMELY disorganized, and does not follow any structure at all. The topics each week are almost completely random. Linda marks unfairly. I am considering getting help for emotional/mental damage after taking a course with Linda.

Terrible experience. She is an incredibly slow marker, gives an absurd amount of meaningless readings, and has horrible communication skills. Her OUTLINES for projects, tests, and assignments ranged from 11 to more than 20 pages in length. She is unable to succinctly summarize information, resulting in mass confusion. Avoid her classes!

Syllabus and project guidelines are all SUPER disorganized. She takes MONTHS to mark work. Final is due today but still no midterm grades. Doesn't communicate at all with TA-I feel bad for him. Lectures and readings are all super long (avg 60 pgs/week) with no benefit. She doesn't understand you have other classes. Don't take this as a GPA booster

Her Canvas page was full of clutter, making it hard to navigate. Her Tutorials were okay, but the overall class structure was pathetic. She's probably a better prof in person, but I wouldn't count on it. Don't take the course as a GPA booster, her weekly readings are very time-consuming, and so are the discussion questions.
David really wants his students to pass. He gives you all the resources you need to succeed, if you put some effort in his class is a GPA booster. Take his class!

David was one of the most caring professors I have ever had. He's kind, passionate and is very interactive and encourages discussion, as well as funny. For the main essay I was really overwhelmed with school and he totally understood and granted me a generous extension. B/c of him I want to pursue maybe a minor in poli sci or international studies.

Knowledgeable and well-versed on political science. Going to lecture was engaging and rewarding, and I would definitely consider taking other political science course with him even though its not my major. Only complaint is that his marking is a bit harder than most first year courses, but this pushes you to understand the material better.

David makes class so interesting and interactive. His lectures are more seminar based so you participate a lot but everything is super relevant and concepts are very clear by the end of lecture. He provides online office hours and is super quick at replying to emails and is always in his office ready to help.

The kindest professor I have ever had. Clearly wants his students to succeed and cares what everyone has to say. Extremely helpful and always goes the extra mile. Super knowledgeable and passionate about his subject matter. I would DEFINITELY take a class with him again!
Great
amazing prof and his TA richard was class too

Mike is a super nice guy. Although I never met him because the class was online, he came across really caring and compassionate in his emails. He is very interested in the class material as demonstrated in his lectures which was great for anyone but especially me, a first year student.

I've taken classes with Mike twice now, and he is a GEM. Literally one of the most genuinely funny and kind profs at SFU, especially in political science. I plan on taking every class I can get with him. He is lenient with extensions and released our final one day early for extra time, and marks very fair. Overall, you'll love him.

Dr. Prest's grading is very arbitrary and unfair. The rubric is very vague about what the assignment wants and the TA reduces marks very randomly with little explanation. For the exams you have 24 hours ( more like 12) to write an essay and the grading criteria for them is unfair considering the time that we have and how this is a first year course

he is such a boring prof and marks so hard. the highest grade on most of the assignments was 17/20. You have to do all the readings and even then u have to follow the criteria very specifically. Such a hard and boring class because of the way he talks.

I finished the class with an A. Very easy class. Just make sure to do well on the group project and to keep up with the readings and lectures. Prest is fair and approachable. I got sick and needed an extension and he was kind and gave me one on one of our papers. One of my fav poli sci profs, as he genuinely cares about his students!

Stewart is an amazing prof! I have taken a couple of classes with him, and his lectures are very informative. For each assignment he gives clear instructions on what he was looking for and the feedback for each assignment outlined what needed to be fixed. Not an easy marker but definitely a fair marker. Highly recommend taking a class with him!
